io.vertx.core.dns.impl.netty

Class DnsResponseHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.vertx.core.dns.impl.netty.DnsHeader
      • io.vertx.core.dns.impl.netty.DnsResponseHeader

  • public class DnsResponseHeader
extends DnsHeader
    The DNS response header class which is used when receiving data from a DNS server. Contains information contained in a DNS response header, such as recursion availability, and response codes.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class io.vertx.core.dns.impl.netty.DnsHeader

        OPCODE_IQUERY, OPCODE_QUERY, TYPE_QUERY, TYPE_RESPONSE

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      DnsResponseHeader(DnsMessage<? extends DnsResponseHeader> parent, int id)
      Constructor for a DNS packet response header.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getReadAdditionalResources()
      Returns the number of additional resource records to read for this DNS response packet.
      int getReadAnswers()
      Returns the number of answers to read for this DNS response packet.
      int getReadAuthorityResources()
      Returns the number of authority resource records to read for this DNS response packet.
      int getReadQuestions()
      Returns the number of questions to read for this DNS response packet.
      int getResponseCode()
      Returns the 4 bit return code.
      int getType()
      Returns the DnsMessage type.
      int getZ()
      Returns the 3 bit reserved field 'Z'.
      boolean isAuthoritativeAnswer()
      Returns true if responding server is authoritative for the domain name in the query message.
      boolean isRecursionAvailable()
      Returns true if DNS server can handle recursive queries.
      boolean isTruncated()
      Returns true if response has been truncated, usually if it is over 512 bytes.

      Set to true if responding server is authoritative for the domain name in the query message.
      void setReadAdditionalResources(int readAdditionalResources)
      Sets the number of additional resources to be read after this header has been decoded.

      Sets the number of answers that should be read after this header has been decoded.

      Sets the number of authority resources to be read after this header has been decoded.

      Sets the number of questions that should be read after this header has been decoded.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DnsResponseHeader

        public DnsResponseHeader(DnsMessage<? extends DnsResponseHeader> parent,
                         int id)
        Constructor for a DNS packet response header. The id is received by reading a DnsQuery and is sent back to the client.
        Parameters:
        parent - the DnsMessage this header belongs to
        id - a 2 bit unsigned identification number received from client

      • setZ

        public void setZ(int z)
        Sets the field Z. This field is reserved and should remain as 0 if the DNS server does not make usage of this field.
        Parameters:
        z - the value for the reserved field Z

      • setResponseCode
